content.description: First route on the left. Starts in less than stellar, pale colored rock. Stick clip the first bolt and then climb up some friable rock, or enter from the left via a traverse to the right.  The most interesting feature and saving grace of this route is a tight lay-away after 20 ft that is accomplished with a nice series of technical switches in body position; better if you are short. Finishing this interesting sequence gains a stance on the left. The rest of the route climbs up some very slopey features on bullet proof stone. We stayed a bit left of the seam, although this section climbs nicely on very tenuous feet.

Soma begin just right of Designer Genes. Make a few moves on scaley rock past a bolt. Crank up to below an overhang. Crank past the overhang(crux) and continue up corner on good holds to the anchor. Great climbing and good protection.
content.protection: Eight bolts to a two bolt anchor.

content.description:
Pitch 1 (5.9): face climb through the smooth gray rock face to the right of the large roof alcove.  After a ragged start, the rock is excellent and clean. There are a few thin moves in the middle, then head left from bolt 5 to find the top anchors.

Pitch 2 (5.11c): head up to the right from the belay ledge.
content.protection:
P1: 5 bolts to double anchor shared with

Frankenfood

.

P2: 6 bolts to anchors.
content.location:
This is the furthest right route in the Roof Alcove area.  Start just downhill from

Frankenfood

and traverse into the route, or start lower and ascend 20 feet to the first bolt.

content.description: Start up a large roof with jugs, then do a short traverse left. Follow flakes with surprisingly good hands and bad feet. Finish at one of two sets of anchors.
content.location:
This is the first route to the right of

Soma

. Start just to the left of the big cave.

content.description:
Seemingly overlooked for years, Leona takes the most obvious face up Conspiracy, just to the right of

Soma

.

Start under the first permadraw and work up a thoughtful sequence to gain a sloping ledge.  From here, rest up because you wont get much until the top.  Negotiating the third quickdraw may be tricky (kneebar helps), but not so bad once you figure it out.  From there, tackle a series of crimps, gastons, and boulder problems each increasing in difficulty until the final sequence culminates in a pumpy deadpoint to a jug.  Hang on for easier climbing for two more bolts to the chains.

Unlike your typical Clear Creek route, this one relies more on precision, beta-refining, and pump management.  Although the final boulder problem is the hardest (V7ish), its less of a stopper move, and more about having enough reserves in your tank.  There are multiple ways to do almost every sequence, so don't get too set on your beta.  This is a true sport climbers route on high quality rock.

Michael Hauck

spotted the line at the beginning of the pandemic, and equipping/working it together during that time provided some much needed relief to the craziness of the world in 2020.  And now we're happy to share it with our Colorado family!
content.location: The obvious line up the black and white face equipped with permadraws.

content.description:
Pitch 1 (10d): climb up into a left-facing corner, over a bulge, then an easy slope to anchors. It is a bit pumpy getting over the bulge, or one can move right onto the arete at this point. The rock is crumbly in places and needs to clean up.

Pitch 2 (11c): head left above the ledge.
content.protection:
P1: 5 bolts to top anchors shared with

Martians on Mopeds

.

P2: 6 bolts to anchors.
content.location: This is the first route below and right from the roof alcove.

content.description: From the left end of the crag, pick out the obvious crack that starts 20 feet off the ground, second route from the left. Tricky entry moves at 5.11 gain the base of the crack. Jam up for 30 feet or so to gain a horizontal seam and crack system. A short traverse left gains the anchor. The quality of the climbing and the stone probably warrant the three stars; however, I suspect that the three star rating of a route with bolts adjacent to perfect Friend placements will rain calumny down upon my head. Nonetheless, I found the climbing to be excellent all the way. As the FA team explained, this crag will hold 99.99 percent sport routes. If you happen to bring the trad rack, do it on gear, otherwise just dig it for what it is - superb climbing on good stone.

Climb 5.9 for two bolts up the corner to a ledge, right of the bolt line. Step left, and climb delicate and technical moves on crimps and slopers for two more bolts (crux) leading to a stem rest in the corner to the left under the prominent roof. Rest here, then blast to the chains on slightly easier terrain.

Take care on the first two bolts as a fall will cause a pretty big swing leftward into the opposing corner.

The rock is good quality. It would be 4 stars if it were longer.
content.location:
This route is in a corner on clean rock about 100m to the right (west) of the main part of the cliff hosting

Designer Genes

and

Soma

in a easy-to-recognize dihedral. When approaching Conspiracy, you will see this corner to the right of the trail; there is a faint fork about 100m before you reach the main wall, allowing you to head straight for Alien Autopsy from that point.
